intro: Parasponia aspera, commonly known as the rough parasponia, is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is a perennial shrub characterized by its rough, hairy stems and broad, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or reddish in color. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. Parasponia aspera is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or along stream banks.
